resources.string:
Controls the base drop speed of the blocks. 
 A larger number means a faster drop speed. 
 
 Units: Lines/Frame 
 From 0.0 to 20.0 (Default: 0.05)

Controls the frame rate of the game.
 A larger number means a faster frame rate. 
 Note: A faster frame rate increases the base drop speed of the blocks.
 
 Units: Frames/Second 
 From 1 to 60 (Default: 30)

Controls the sensitivity threshold of the flick gestures. 
 A larger number means that a faster swipe is need for it to register as a gesture. 
 
 Units: Velocity of Swipe (Pixels/Detection Cycle) 
 From 1 to Infinity (Default: 30)

Controls the delay before a block locks in place. 
 A larger number means a longer delay. 
 
 Units: Milliseconds 
 From 0 to Infinity (Default: 1000)

Controls the drop speed of the block while soft dropping. 
 A larger number means a faster soft drop speed. 
 This is a multipler of the base drop speed. 
 
 Units: None 
 From 1.0 to Infinity (Default: 9)

Controls:
 	 Move Left/Right: Drag Left/Right 
 	 Hard Drop: Swipe Down 
 	 Soft Drop: Drag Down 
 	 Hold Block: Swipe Up 
 
 
 Version: 1.0.0
 By Jerry Jiang (aka tpcstld)
